review: Why did this place only  get a threee star rating? It's so much better than that. They have a great onion rings and shakes and more. I love going there. It's kind of a long drive for me but well worth it. I will always love the Red Robin, just great burgers. My fav is the Red Robin burger. Love it, just wish it was closer.

How many times has anyone went to Red Robin? Too many to count. UNFORTUNATELY my family will NOT be coming back to this particular one, unless it's happening to all the Red Robin's!! We went today for happy hour and to get the usual, bottomless fries and root beer floats. We walked in and wanted to be seated in the bar area. We were informed that nobody under the age of 21 isn't allowed. We ask since when and she couldn't give us a right answer. So we asked if we sit in the restaurant area if we could still get the happy hour service there. She said she'll have to see if a server can come and help us in that area. Really?? Well, Brett didn't like that answer and we left. I wish that I stepped up and asked another manager besides her. That stinks! I really hope that other Red Robin's aren't doing this because they'll lose a lot of service! I will be calling and getting some answers!

I LOVE RED ROBIN! Simple as that. I don't know how I went so long without eating here! I guess every time I suggested going to Red Robin, nobody seemed to like the idea. Not one person I know said anything except "I heard they are expensive!". Seriously, this comment was all I heard about it. Well I know now to not listen to anyone unless they have actually been to the place. Anyway, moving on. Red Robin is a really great burger restaurant with a great atmosphere and friendly service. They have more food than just burgers. So far I have tried their bacon avocado burger,  the 'seafood scatter', (which is a platter of seafood :golden brown cod, fried shrimp and clam strips: with fries and cole slaw), and the Three For All appetizer. The seafood was perfect! It tasted amazing and the portion was huge! I had the 'Hawaiian Heart Throb' smoothie (strawberries, banana, coconut cream and pineapple juice) and it was delicious! No matter what I get, I always substitute the regular fries with the sweet potato fries. They are so yummy! The burgers are huge and they all kinds of different tastes to pick from.  I plan to be a regular at this joint! Update: I love the "Three For All".  The Bacon Aioli is AMAZING!!!

First off, to reviewer who was complaining about people under 21 not being able to be in the bar area, that's just state law. No way to change that and furthermore, for those of us that are BEYOND sick and tired off hearing bratty kids and crying babies, the bar areas are a reprieve from people with snotty, ill-behaved children. It used to be when I was a kid (which wasn't that long ago) kids were taught to have manners in eating establishments, not anymore. I was taken outside if I ever cried or screamed or intruded on someones peace, but not anymore. Bars are the only place to get away from indulgent oblivious parents with their bratty children so thank goodness for Red Robin enforcing state law. Anyway, on to my review of this actual Red Robin. Out of all the Red Robins I have been to, this one by far has the worst service. Service was terrible (and the place was slow) and our food was cold and delivered at different times. If you are looking for a good experience, go to a different location.

The two star rating is for the new policy that closed off 1/2 of the restaurant.  Don't me wrong...Red Robin is a safe bet for good food at a fair price but if you have to wait longer to be seated then it isn't worth it. What have they changed?  The bar area with additional seating is no longer available for family dining (as per the hostess the evening we went).  This decision by Red Robin has decreased the available seating to about half.  So now if you want to go there with anyone under 21 you will have a long wait for a table.   We probably will not be going back to Red Robin :-(.

Although usually very satisfied when dining in at this Red Robin, I put in a to go order last Friday.  I called the Hemet resaturant, and placed my order to go.  The girl who took my order said it would be ready in 10 minutes.  When I arrived, they couldn't locate my order and asked if I called the Hemet Red Robin.  I informed them I did, and they took my order again.  When I returned a 2nd time to pick up my food, the girl who was at the bar/take out area gave me my food, but I noticed something was missing.  While I was checking my food, a group of people arrived at the bar to get drinks.  She asked them if they were there to eat or get seated, and they said they were there for drinks.  After I told her that they didn't get my order correct, she just left without saying anything, then appeared with my missing order of fries.  The people at the bar were just annoyed that she just walked away from them.  She then proceeded to say that she just got off of her break and everything was a mess.  When I got home, the ensenada chicken platter was messy and they did  not include any of the dipping sauces it's supposed to come with.  Never again will I get take out from this location.
As good as they get!!  We eat here regularly since the day they opened and have always had EXCELLENT SERVICE, GREAT FOOD!  :)

My wife ate at the Red Robin in Hemet, CA a couple of weeks ago.  It was mid-afternoon (too late for lunch and too early for dinner) so it wasn't very busy when we arrived.  We were warmly greeted when we entered the restaurant the hostess and promptly seated at a nearby booth. The server was busy finishing up with another customer so after only about a minute, the manager came by and explained that the server would be right with us and took my wife's drink order (Very Berry Raspberry Limeade) while he was there (I wasn't ready to order yet). The server made it to our table about a minute later.  She was friendly and took my drink order (Freckled Lemonade) while we continued to look over the menu.  When the server brought my drink, we place our food order.  I ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger and my wife ordered the Prime Rib Dip.  They delivered the food to our table in about 5 minutes and it looked very good.  My burger had good flavor and ample toppings.  The fries were crisp with plenty of potato flavor.  My wife thought her sandwich tasted good but that there was too much bread, so took the top off, and ate it open-face style.  It tried my wife's drink thought that both her drink and mine were weak.  The strawberries in mine were soft and mushy like they had been frozen and thawed.  They weren't very appealing and had very little flavor.   We'll probably stick with cokes or iced teas next time. Overall, the service was very good (although my wife thought it was a little intrusive), the food was very good but the drinks could have been better.  We'll probably return when were in town again.
The hummus platter is killer. I highly recommend just eating as a meal not just an appetizer. Hope you like finger food. The service is okay/pretty good. Don't forget the full bar.

Did someone say unlimited fries?? They have awesome french fries here and they're unlimited!!!  yayyyy. I usually eat a classic cheeseburger wrapped in lettuce so I don't feel so bad about the carbs I'm having with so many fries and ranch.  They're strawberry lemonade is by far one of the best I've ever had! I usually get the arnold palmer with strawberry lemonade. The bitterness from the ice tea compliments the sweetness of the strawberry lemonade to make my perfect drink. (I don't drink overly sweet stuff) They also have a BBQ burger with onion strings that is off the hook! They also have other lemonades and spritzers that are good, I usually sip the ones that my family gets because I could never drink a full glass of those. I avoid those high calorie drinks so that I could use them better eating fries dipped in ranch. I like this location because is not as crowded as other ones. Pretty nice area, will definitely come back when I come on this side of town.
Fun drinks. Great French fry seasoning. Humorous hamburgers

Service was S-L-O-W even though the restaurant was almost empty, food was alright. So waiting a long time for alright food is worth about 2 stars to me. Last time I'm visiting this place. Should have stuck to my gut and get tacos from Chagolla's again.

Barf!!! This place is horrible. The spinach artichoke dip was so nasty, I ordered a turkey club with some sauce and the bread was cheap, white, thick and omg I could go on and on. The server looked ghetto and unclean. Everything was frozen and then popped in an oven, it was so low quality. Don't waste your money here.
Great food as usual!  Came in for lunch and  enjoyed every bite!  The strawberry lemonade was delicious!

I have to say the service we revived was second to none. We have great food and the staff was very friendly here. This is the best place to bring your family too. We were seated quickly and the food was really good. This place should get more stars like this. If you are gonna eat in Hemet eat at this place.
Great service! We ask for the same server Each time and she brings our drinks to the table as she comes to greet us. Classic food, bottomless fries. Eat local.

Let me just say how much this place has stepped it up!! New menu items (wedge salad is yum and is only 3 bucks!!), still love that the bar is 21+ only and Rochelle is the best server I've ever had. By far. And yes, at a Red Robin. This location has never disappointed me especially sitting in the bar area. Always have great appetizers for such a great price and their burgers with endless fries?? Yes please. Oh yeah, and their pretzel bites?? Can't get enough of those either :)

Always my favorite burger joint.  I always ordered the same thing...the Monster Burger which they no longer have on their menu!!!  Why?  It was the greatest thing ever and probably their biggest seller. Now, you can make your own burgers, sort of, but none of the employees know how the Monster Burger was made.  How can that be?   It's two patties with two slices of cheese Special sauce (mayo and pickle relish mix I think) tomato and red onion.  Don't think there was lettuce on it. SERVICE last time:  it was my birthday and I had my Red Robin Royalty card out.  Maybe the waitress thought she'd be getting a smaller tip and didn't want to put much effort into it. (I ALWAYS TIP BEFORE DISCOUNT IS TAKEN OFF)   Plus the manager and bartender decided to have an employee meeting about what the drink special was going to be that night.  Service was very slow and we almost walked out to go to Burger King next door. Food was as good as expected.  Didn't get my Monster Burger but it's my favorite place to go. Someone has to remember how to make it.  I've also emailed the company about this burger.

Went with my family cause my daughter really wanted to go. Hostess was the only good part. Service was so very slow. Burger and fries must have sat in the window cause they were cold. Did not get some good we asked for. No one ever checked to see if we were ok. Bad, bad , bad. Never to return . Take the 20 min drive and go to rubys by cabazon great burgers every time .

Ok, updating my review. This place still has great customer service. Came here with one other person and our waitress was attentive and asked a lot of questions about our order, in a good way. The food was infinitely better. It might have been because it was dinner time vs. Lunch. I'd come back.

Left my credit card by accident the other day.  Wasn't even worried about anything happening to it.  Of course, they had it locked up in the manager's office.  This location continues to be a great, inviting place to bring the family.  Food is always great and service is always friendly!
Omg the whiskey bbq burger is the bomb.the service was impeccable highly recommend to anyone

I have rarely had service as good as this place gave my family. The hostess was  friendly and efficient, people were hustling to take care of the customers. When we were first seated I was not happy, we were sitting right next to the restrooms.  Everything was great though as soon as our server, Tylre, shoed up. She was efficient, friendly and informative, everything a server should be. Tylre was always there as soon as a drink was empty. She was like magic with her ability to keep us well watered.       The food was absolutely amazing, I had the smoke and pepper burger which was sooooooo GOOD!  The experience was satisfying, very satisfying.

Besides the fact that I just spent my morning throwing up my dinner from this place for reasons unknown, they are always understaffed! Every time I've been here I end up waiting forever to get seated, waiting forever to order, waiting to get my food...one time we went in here & had to wait forever to be seated while there were lots of empty booths open & the employees were just standing around looking like they needed something to do! Thumbs down.

Let me start off by saying I usually go to red robin in Redlands and its always ridiculous busy but they always serve us within 1 to 2 minutes and always do a good job. We went to this one in hemet and it wasn't even close to busy so we were seated quickly but that was about it. It was just 2 of us and we waited at least 10 minutes and nobody even came by to ask what we wanted to drink. Servers kept walking past us so we just got impatient and left without anyone saying anything to us. I've never had that happen anywhere at a restaurant

Decent.  Did take-out here, and it was decent.  Typical Red Robin, not great, not horrible, just decent. The whole setup for take-out is awkward, though.  Go stand at the bar and wait for the bartender to take care of it?  Not fantastic.  Food traveled about ~10 minutes, and was somewhat OK.  Overall, I'd not recommend it for take-out; probably eat-in only.
Our food sat under heat lamps for 10 minutes. Waitress never came by to check on us for drink refills. Poor service. Cold food. Manager seemed unconcerned with the poor service.
I really enjoyed everything that I ordered today. I got the red Tavern BBQ Burger. So amazing! Next time I will hold the mayo & add extra BBQ sauce!!! The tower of onion rings never disappoints!

One of the few good places to eat in Hemet. Great burgers and sandwiches. Bottomless fries. Last week we went for lunch and they were pretty busy and it looked like they had a new serving crew, after we placed our order the waiter came back 15 min later telling us he forgot to place the order and will bring it out ASAP and we accepted his honesty mistake but because we were short on time I asked if they can box it up instead in which he did. The manager came to our table to apologize and not only comped our lunch but also gave us a 20.00 voucher for our next visit. And the food was still warm when we got home. Awesome customer service and will continue to eat here. Very happy.
This is the place to go if u want a great burger and fries. Nice ambience. Nice service. Definitely will be coming back.

Unlike the South San Diego (Chula Vista) Red Robin location, a friendly staff member has always greeted me immediately as I walk in.  The menu has improved over the past year, with several new options for vegetarians, vegans, and the lactose intolerant.  Unlimited broccoli (yes!). The broccoli has always tasted fresh, and is mostly the floret portion (many restaurants serve broccoli that is mostly stem, not Red Robin - they serve the yummy floret with very little rubbery stalk interruptions). Red Robin's yummy steak fries are excellent (and deserving of all of the praise/hype) but I rarely enjoy them due to my dietary concerns.  Many options for buns and sauces.  Options, options, options!   Great menu, great value (the recent price increases were mostly 75 cents or less, and seem to have only affected the gourmet burger choices), and friendly staff.  1 star removed because even the friendliest waiters (at both the Hemet and Chula Vista locations) seem to avoid your table after your food has been delivered.  Perhaps to avoid having to provide for "bottomless" fries and broccoli?  not sure, but its a bit aggravating. Also a bit of a challenge to get their attention for drink refills.  Even given this odd quirk, I must give my fellow readers a recommendation for the Hemet Red Robin.  The many good aspects outweigh my one quibble, the menu is excellent, and the dining area is clean.

Went to get my Birthday burger, and they REFUSED because they were running a different promo at the time. Even though I just got the e-mail that said come get your B-day Burger this month. Very disappointed. See you NO TIME SOON!
Great food, friendly hostess/waiter/waitresses, very clean. My favorite thing to order is the fish n chips! Best fish n chips I've  ever had. Oh, and they have yummy milkshakes!

I always enjoy coming here for the Fries and BLTA Croissant. So my tip is to get the campfire sauce and dip your fries in that , so good. The BLTA croissant is so good,I get it every time.  If you save room for dessert get the mile high mud pie ! Soo good!
Doing that Red Robin thing tonight,  it's still 91 degrees at 8:00, just too damm hot to cook. We wish that they would bring back the clam strips as an appetizer.

Wow i did not expect to have great service. My fiance and I went in there for lunch on Wednesday and to be honest I did not expected much. The waitress was very nice and promt with our food and service. We both order burgers with bottomless fries which were tasted great. I will come here again and hopefully the service is still as great as the other day.

Our Server Aldo was amazing! He was tentative, fun and right on target with timing. Our food was fantastic but it almost could not compare to the service. We spend about $60 on our bill but tipped him $20 simply because we have not had great service like that in such a long time and we thought he should be rewarded. I am going to fill out the little survey on my receipt to help him out but I also wanted it known on a public forum that everyone who comes to this location should ask to sit in Aldo's section.

Food was ok. Service was ok. My complaint.  Which is a major one,  When I was served my drink the cup had old dried up food on it. I informed the server and a new drink was brought to me which also had food Residue on the inside floating around! GROSS..

Today I experienced one of the worst things that a eating establishment in our small town could do to its local customers during the annual Christmas parade.  My plan for the day was to park in the red robin parking lot to enjoy the parade and after the parade enjoy taking my family to red robin for a birthday luncheon for my wife and son but I soon came to realize this would not happen.  A female employee was coming out to the parking lot telling everyone they could not park their vehicles in their establishment for the Christmas parade. I tried to explain to her that we were planning to have lunch at her restaurant and her comment to me was "Everyone says that" so I stated to her that I would be more then happy to go in and purchase a gift card to show that my intention in being a patron after the parade was true, her comment to that was "no, if she did it for me she would have to do it for everyone." Now take this into account, the remaining business' around them (burger king, mimis, family dollar, fitness 19, pep boys) had no problem allowing their community to park in their lots to celebrate and enjoy the Christmas parade.  With that being said I will no longer be a patron nor will I be a supporter of our local red robin since they could not allow the many citizens of hemet use their precious parking spaces, and like me many if not all those turned away are patrons of red robin.

Our server Jasmine was fast and attentive to our drinks. Chicken Ensenada was Awesome ! Wife had the Bonzai burger well done. We left full and satisfied.  I love red robin.  It's like my home away from home.
had the worst experience with a server here ever.  super slow service with anything from the bar and especially "endless" fries.  I won't get into all the details but it was ridiculous.

Red Robin does have good burgers, but they are sooooo expensive.  I could make equally good burgers at home for a fraction of the price.  That makes their burger really hard to swallow.  I recently ate there with mom and some friends and my bill alone was $23- just mine.  And I only had a burger and a soda!  I did upgrade to the sweet potato fries but come on.  The burgers are not THAT spectacular. Service is friendly...but not $23 friendly.
Loved the food (as always) and the customer service was great. We had a group of 8 people and service was wonderful. Foothill Ranch Location!

We love this place! My families favorite place for their birthdays. My son has been going for a few years on his birthday and they know who he is. Always accommodating his needs. I think in the years that we have been dining here, we have only had 1 bad experience. Love Red Robin
I was very happy with our experience.   Basic red robin but it was fresh and service was great.

This was actually my first time to a Red Robbins, and overall it wasn't to bad. The service was great at this location, the atmosphere was good, but the bathrooms however were lacking service. The prices are average, and it kind of reminded me of a Ruby's dinner. I do want to go back to try some different items on the menu.  I ordered the classic RR cheeseburger with everything on it, and had it cooked medium rare. The meat was cooked good, and the burger itself was good as well. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to finish all of it. Since I mostly got full off of the thick hamburger bun. One of the things that I don't like is when the bun is bigger than the meat, and everything in the burger itself.

I had the opportunity to sit down and have lunch at Red Robin today and I had the prime rib dip with coleslaw and endless fries.  The service I received today was a 10 out of 10 and the food was great the flavors blended will as their prime rib dip with the closest law had of been a great taste to it but it was masked by the fries and campsauce.  My house its was great promply settles down and our server promptly came over and took our order I will be returning with great expectations for this place the visit was a success

the fries were good... The prime rib dip sucked, it was way too salty and dry. The seafood platter scatter had no taste whatsoever nothing on the menu to rate it was over salted. Service was ok that's why it gets 2 stars besides that not impressed at all.
We've eaten here more than a few times, never have had a problem, foods always good, service is great and the place is always clean. In Hemet that's above and beyonds 5 Star LOL.

Aldo, the server, was great!  Went on a busy Friday night, but was seated and served quickly. Don't get the guacamole and salsa with chips.  You only get a small sauce cup of each.  Small but, good.  Good burgers (not great). I've been there before, and will go again.
this place is delicious service is great food good they treat you wonderful very attentive

Last week, my best friend and I returned to the Hemet Red Robin.  We have previously enjoyed the burgers, and they make a great bloody mary.  We treat ourselves on the infrequent times we get to visit ( I live 100 miles away) and are never disappointed.   On this particular occasion, we were also wowed by the excellent service we received from Brenna (I sure hope I have the name right...she's tall and dark haired; recently from Oregon).  What a personable and helpful server!  She made great recommendations and went out of her way to make our lunch wonderful.   Many thanks to Brenna and the whole team at the Hemet Red Robin.  I had recently been to the Lakewood location and had terrible service and substandard food, so learned that  this chain is not consistent.  What makes the difference is great people!
Terrible service .. Been sitting here for almost 30 min ... Still haven't taken my order ... I'm starving !
Red Robin has great food. Always pleased with the bottomless fries. Customer service is fine. Loud atmosphere. Good  for keeping up with the sports network.

If waiting for 45 mins for drinks and still no fries which are bottomless is considered quality service then everyone please come to red robin and enjoy the wait. Worse service I have ever had. For the quality  of food I will never come back and I'm holding back from upper decking there toilet.

BRENNA BRENNA BRENNA! My sisters and I just ate here and really enjoyed our meal.  Our waitress was extremely attentive and easy to chat with.  She seems to genuinely like her job.  Red Robin if she doesn't get a raise soon you crazy!
Great burgers and service couldn't be happier with this place. I'm been here a hand full of times and I'm sure I'll be back. The beer selection is also great.

Just had the worst meal of my life, if I could give it negative stars I would. I ordered the B D G burger which is supposed to be a beef patty with arugula and sun dried tomatoes with a citrus dressing. I asked for it medium well, with broccoli substituted for fries. We also ordered onion rings for the table. We received the onion rings without any silverware or napkins, and nobody came around to ask for them. Eventually the burgers came, my husband and I both ordered the burgers bunless and with broccoli substituted. They forgot to substitute the fries on both orders, waitress went back to get the broccoli. My patty came over burnt and charcoal black, and was so hard and dry could crack it. It came with a small pile of limp and old arugula, with no citrus dressing. Again I had to ask for silverware and napkins. The patty lost all its meat flavor and I felt like I was simply eating charcoal. The "sun dried tomatoes" we're cold and already tasted vinegary and past their due date. As I looked down  I could even see dirty spots on the plate from the reflection of the light above. Then the broccoli came and It was very old looking and dry as well. I was so hungry and in a rush and would not have time for the food to be remade, so I sucked it up and asked for bbq sauce to mask the patty and somehow eat it. The only thing that didn't make it worse was the fact that the only edible thing was the fries, which I got by mistake. For all of that I was charged 13$, when I could have just gone to Inn-out for a PERFECTLY cooked burger and fries for $6.  Our whole bill for three burgers and onion fries was $60, and we were left with the after taste of a rip off. Waitress was sweet but management and chefs need a reality check for selling old and badly cooked food to customers.

We have eaten here about 4 times ~ The first time we ate in { burgers } and a beer . The second time my hubby had the Fish and Chips  with a salad .  I had the Nantucket Platter  , with Clam Strips ,Cod and Shrimp , Don had a Beer , I ordered a Salted Margarita on the rocks . His was to come with a frosted mug { first one was barely cold , they ran out of  cold mugs , they forgot to put them in to get frosted . my Maggie was missing something major  , I reordered it was served the same way again { with a different tequila } Still had the same non Margarita taste { they forgot the roses Lime } . I'm ashamed to say this was for a Birthday Dinner . My Mom ordered the same as me with a side wedge salad ~ All the food was cold . limp fries , limp under cooked  { not crispy } fish shrimp and clams . We had to wait over an hour for food and there were only about 8-9 tables taken . That was  Sept of Last year .  So we decided to try again tonight . It took 2 hours to get a to go order { they messed it up } My food was burnt and missing my clam strips  , Don's was the wrong order { burger } I did not get dressing for salad . Needless to say $ 45.00 later was the worse meal I have had period . I would not eat there again if it was for free .

First time at this location, I might return if I read better reviews in the future. The water was gross, the waitress was very slow (No, there was not a lunch time rush), I ordered my burger well done and I received a medium rare instead. Afraid to request a more cooked patty out of fear that someone might tamper with my food (Nothing personal towards this location, I just worry about that everywhere I go) I decided to just eat it. Not even 30 minutes have passed since we left this restaurant and my stomach has been cramping up and I feel extremely nauseous. The only reason they're getting 2 stars is because it seemed clean and the fries were good. Other than that I don't recommend this location. Very disappointed :(

First time at red robin. Service was slow. Food was bad. I ordered bbq burger w/ garlic fries. Burger was ok. Garlic fries didn't even taste like garlic. No seasoning on any of the food. Poutine fries were the worst barely any gravy and again no seasoning. Also ordered a spicy sombrero salad. worst salad ive ever seen. For $11 i wouldve thought it was a hearty salad. This place is a joke to the food industry. Wouldnt recommend this place to anyone. Save your money.

I actually really love the burgers at red robin. This red robin, like most things in Hemet, isn't as good as it would be if you had it anywhere else. There is a distinct difference in the way things taste here than say temecula or any other location I've been to. My advice is if you want a burger from Red robin, wait until you are out of town to get it.

Great burgers. Great service.  We've been to this RR three times since we arrived in July to visit the area. We usually order the Simple Burger. Moist and delicious. The onion straws are good. The new cheese curds are not good, nor are they worth 5 bucks. Our waitresses have been attentive and sweet. Overly accommodating. We'll go back.

+Food tasted great. -Hardly any service (waiters/waitresses never came over to ask if we needed anything). We were at a table without napkins or utensils and it took some time to wait to see a waiter/waitress to flag down who idn't flash by. Then it took some time to ask for a refill. However they were there asap when it came to the bill. I don't fault the waiters/waitresses however (if any management is reading) since they looked like they were working at top speed. To me it seemed like they needed more staff and due to the lack of it they're producing bad customer service and probably losing business. And even more shocking to that was that was it seemed that it wasn't even half way full on our side of the restaurant. What happens when they get more people in... it would be horrible, just go somewhere else. -The wait for food was long. We ordered an appetizer and at least one main dish. The appetizer came out with the main. Usually, in my mind, you eat the appetizer while they take forever to make the food. Except.. they delivered it and the end. conclusion, *tasted great *bad customer service

This was our first time at Red Robin in years and it will be our last. The service was absolutely atrocious as was the food. Our waitress screwed up our order so bad that we had to get the manager involved. First, entrees arrive before appetizers as she forgot to put our appetizer in. Then, they brought the wrong appetizer. In the meantime, several people seated after us were finishing up their meal. Manager made the appetizer right and we started our meal. Cheese curds and Jalapeno rings were good. However, burgers were very dry as I had asked for mine to be a little pink. I didn't bother asking them to fix the burger as we already had problems with appetizers and getting the food took way too long. Bratwurst on new burger had a very funny taste to it - not good... Manager took $15 off the bill but then tried to charge us for an extra Onion Ring that we didn't even order. Took them two trips to register to get it right. The whole experience was just a disaster. To top off, we mentioned that it was my daughter's birthday and they said they would sing and bring a sundae to her. They sort of abandoned us after the check was paid and we had to remind them about the birthday celebration. Thanks for screwing up my daughter's birthday meal!!! Just pathetic!!!

Great burger, but didn't get what I ordered.  Paid for it with a gift card and the receipt given did not reflect what was ordered, only the amount charged.  This might not keep me out of a Red Robin in the future, but it diminished this first-time experience for sure.

Good food. Decent service. The outside and the dining area was clean but the bathroom was horrible. Urine on the floor, water all over the floor and sink, and paper towel overflowing in the trash. You know the employees had to go in there at some point and just ignored the mess. Makes me wonder what the kitchen looks like.

Came here for my sister's 18th birthday. Waited about 25 minutes, but that's understandable. Host were very nice, our waitress was awesome!! Food was awesome. The only thing we all didn't like was that every drink we got, was mostly filled with ice than the actual drink. I know some customers usually tell the waitress how they like their drink but common sense would say "that's a little too much ice." Other than that, everything was good.

This is an excellent Red Robin! You can't beat fast friendly service! The food is delicious, and you can't beat the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade! I've tried many of the burgers and chicken sandwiches and they're all delicious! The staff is friendly and I've always had prompt service. Going out to eat with a toddler is challenging, but it is completely doable at this Red Robin. The service is fast and everyone is so helpful and friendly. They always give our toddler a balloon and puts a smile on his face.
This Red Robin Sucks Big Time Shit Bird!! Should be shut down!! The Hostess was never around, the skimpy patty was burnt, and the place was dirty!! What a Rip off Robin!!
Great burgers! Nice staff we always seem to wait awhile before getting our drinks but I guess that depends on what times you go and how busy it gets.
Great food and very quick service.  Waiter who laughs like scooby doo is awesome.  Will return to this restaurant.

If you order now, your food might be ready by 2017. I cannot make up how incredibly slow this Red Robin is at serving food.  Update:  January 30th. Sat down at 1:03pm. It's now 1:58pm and still no food. They remodeled the place, but still slow service

My son and I  always enjoy coming to Red Robin. The service is usually good, however, when it gets busy it's had to get the attention of a waitress/waiter. One of my favorite "sides" is the Onion Strings which aren't on the menu but ask for them. They're an awesome awesomddition to any burger or sandwich.

Server was unintentive. Got my half of my order wrong just because it sounded similar to my fiancee's order. I understand when it gets busy but it wasn't that busy since it didn't take long to be seated. The food was delicious though (for the most part). We had the whiskey chicken wrap. We had done the soup with sandwich deal. However, the clam chowder tasted like it came out of a can. Even Souplantation has better tasting clam chowder than this. I'll probably try a different soup next time.  Honestly we had a better experience the last time we were here.

Had to wait 5 minutes to get a seat in the bar but the service was great. She was very personable & attentive. The burgers were great too perfectly cooked chicken and you gotta love bottomless fries & salad!   Good location with easy access and plenty of parking.

I love eating at red robin in any city I visit but I'm giving this one a 5 star rating for their honesty and help! My boyfriend lost his debit card while at this red robin (not sure if he dropped it or accidentally left it behind) and didn't realize it was missing until 2 days later. We called and found out that the manager had held the card aside waiting for its owner to claim it. We live in Orange County and visit family in hemet so we needed the card mailed back to us. The manager kindly obliged and the card came to us in the mail a few days later complete with coupons! Thank you red robin!
Food was exceptional. I was satisfied and luckily if our server hadn't been great we would have left the restaurant. The system crashed and our order was wrong..... Ill think twice about returning.
Went for lunch yesterday and we had horrible service. I ordered a wrap and there was hardly any chicken in it. Really can't imagine going back now.

Party of 10. Arrived before 7pm on May 10th, and didn't get seated until around/after 8pm after being told wait time was around 25-30 minutes. Several parties were seated ahead of us (yes smaller, but at a point at least 10-15 people were seated ahead of us), and no effort was made to combine tables. Hostess (Brittany) very rude. No smiling, yelled across the room to me after I was in process of calling to verify party number.  She had a very funky nonchalant lackadaisical attitude. If you don't like your job, why are you there?????  She definitely needs major customer service training, and I didn't appreciate the fingernail tapping on the podium after I ask to speak with the manager to find out when we are ever being seated (not something you want to do)! Told manager I'm happy to take our party elsewhere if they chose because we were tired of waiting and being ignored. Finally sit down, waitress is nice but neglected to provide utensils and we waited a decent period of time at the table and had to end up asking her to bring utensils (only brought forks). First bottomless fry order is cold but we were all stressed, hungry, and I was upset after having words with the manager about the situation. Waitress brings out courses but no knife to cut whole heads of ceasar salad. Salad was refused; (grilled, but looked horrible and unappetizing).  Whole experience was bad. Don't think I'll be back again to waste my money when I can go to other places to be appreciated and seated in a timely manner.  Sad thing was only two of us live nearby, the rest of them commuted to eat with us. I'm so sorry I had to show them a bad time and very poor customer service.  When people come out they want to be treated well with smiles!
I regret going to this Red Robin. Service was slower than slow. Literally a half hour before we ever got out first round of drinks. Order wasn't right. Just terrible all around.

I usually order to go. They do a good job with order accuracy, completion time, putting out good burgers, and they have a friendly, helpful staff.  Gotta rush the fries home before they cool down too much so I ask for them to be made fresh.  Recommend.

Great place beer is cold burgers are amazing and most of all friendly staff.  They care about the customers glad I came here  with limited restaurants in hemet  i will choose this over any other  place. Come enjoy some good food cold beer or whatever you enjoy also brenna one of the hardest working waitress she actually cares thank you
The wife and I came here last night and we enjoyed the service and the food. The place was clean and comfortable. We will be back.

I am really disappointed. I eat hear about every other week faithfully. And 07/31/16 was my husbands birthday and out of all the places he could have chose from to have his birthday dinner he chose this place. My first disappoint was how much the servers encourage these new table top ordering tablets which takes away actual communication I believe from the customer. Why have servers? or worry about tipping a waiter or waitress when the machine does everything for you. I know that's this is at almost every restaurant but the waiters actually push it on you. My opinion. And second was that we told the host it was my husbands birthday and she advised she would let our waiter know. During the whole dinner my daughter and I were looking around to see when they would come around to sing to my husband and nothing. We ended up leaving and I had to explain to my husband that we didn't forget they just never came. My husband actually thought we forgot and I was so hurt for him. When I went up to the host to ask her what happened she said I told your waiter I'll let him know he forgot. No sorry. No nothing. I saw her go up to the waiter and they both seemed like it was nothing. To me and my family it was everything. Thank you for ruining our dinner!!!
One of my favorite spots when I come visit my mom. Usually pretty good service that doesn't hover, but is attentive enough to keep our drinks full. Try the pretzel bites with a side a chocolate sauce

When we first moved to Hemet from OC, we went to Red Robin and were very pleased. It was a spot we enjoyed for food, drinks, service, and ambiance. Then we went back a few months ago and all the interesting décor was removed from the bar and it was stark and cold. We asked the server what happened and she said the new manager took everything down. We haven't been back since. The ambiance is an important part of the experience, and it's gone. And so are we.
They have the best servers in town.   Plus, the food is good.

Sunday afternoon 11am- greeted and seated right away with no wait.  Our server Lynsey* ( I think that's how you spell it) went above and beyond to satisfy our visit. I ordered my burger with no lettuce and it came out with lettuce and she quickly got me a new burger and was VERY apologetic. As the church crowd started coming in she was still very consistent and kept our drinks full. The service alone was 5 stars, but the food was also amazing!  Will definitely be returning! Thank you for the awesome service.

Ordered the same whiskey burger like I always get. I was served a cheeseburger with bacon. I said this was not right. The waiter seemed to think I was wrong and said you don't like bacon? Finally he took it away, along with my fries. The manager Ryan, came out , apologized and later brought out another burger. I said this is not right either. It looked like, they took it in the back and removed the bacon and brought it back to me. Ryan, the manager was rude, argued with me. I just said, take it away. So I left without eating except for some fries. They charged me for the coke anyways.  I have been there many times and this was the worst. The waiter seemed new, so I am not blaming him as much as the rude, condescending manager.

I like the updated menu options. I especially love the poutine. I've been to this location a few times in the last few months and started going there because there's a Pokémon gym. It's great to be able to eat, have some drinks and visit with friends, while battling at the gym :) Service has always been expedient, food is about average for what you'd expect. Servers are atentive. Yum!
Great starter Burger! Try wrapping in lettuce, insane. Next stop, DGB! Brandi was on point tonight!

Blake, the general manager is the best! He made it a point to stop by our table and make sure that our meals were perfect & that we were enjoying our visit at Red Robin Hemet. The entire restaurant is so clean & every server is incredible efficient! The bartender, Jen was awesome! She served us quickly & was so personable! Absolutely coming back & appreciate that the food was so fresh & delicious!

Received a gift card for my birthday so went here today use it, food came out after 1/2 hour wait over cooked and meat was very dry, lettuce brown on my salad, waitress never came around to fill ice tea. I won't ever go there again.
Bad experience wife found something black on the ice in her soda water. I pulled ice out it looked like a scab black hard and white underneath and hollow. She was disgusted. We did not eat we left.

Really great experience here. Came in with my family the other day and we were seated immediately. It was a pleasant surprise on a Friday night! Our waitress was Brenna and she is the main reason I'm writing this review because she was phenomenal and her efforts can't go unnoticed. She was very attentive, sweet, and it felt like she went above and beyond. She made what would have been an average visit a great one.  Wonderful service but the food was also amazing. Tried the new Southern Charm burger. Always nervous about trying new things - I'm a creature of habit - but I was not disappointed, everything was great.  And, of course, I ate my weight in sweet potato fries.  Would definitely return to this location!

I am very upset with this location. To make a long story short I had left my phone at this location. When I called back to see if they had it they said that they looked everywhere and there was no phone. I then used find my phone app only to see it was at Red Robin. After asking for a manager and showing them the app was my phone found I'm 10 seconds. Was not upset with the food just appalled by there lack of integrity.

The waitress told my group of co-workers and I "if you take care of me, I'll take care of you". Asking customers for a tip is ridiculously unprofessional. And she took forever to put our order in. I had to cancel my order. Unreal.
Always a great place to just enjoy some free time all depends on who you get for your waitress makes or breaks 5star
Good food, somewhat decent service. Host is a lame brain, but the bartenders are way cool. Going Southern with the Blue Ribbon and a side of slaw.

It's nice to have a Red Robin in this town to go in and grab a burger! This place is mostly always busy every time I've come here! They have vegetarian options available here which is a huge bonus! Waiters/waitresses are all friendly! Service can be slow here but I can't complain given how busy it is the times I've been there. I've only had an issue once where they brought out food for me that was slightly different than what I ordered and the waitress was great and took it back to get it fixed but when I got it back it seemed like they just took of the ingredient I didn't want, which was fine for me but it could be a problem for those that have allergies so make sure anywhere you go and that happens you specifically tell the waiter that your food needs to be redone.  Other than that, clean place/bathrooms, friendly workers, good food, and plenty of parking. It's location is perfect also, it's not in the middle of Florida where it gets super crowded but right before where the traffic starts near the mall.

I normally like Red Robin but tonight made me decide no more. I have no teeth currently ( waiting on dentures) so I need soft foods. I ordered broccoli, extra soft, French onion soup and fries. They couldn't get the broccoli soft. I guess the cook doesn't know how, so I cancelled it after 3 tries. The French onion soup had very little onions and what it did have was super tough. I couldn't eat the onions so I drank the broth and ate the bread that was in it. And the fries? Couldn't eat them. They used to be thick and soft. Now they are cut thin and are tough. I tried 3 batches. On the refills, they weren't made to order. They were sitting on the window already cooked. Even my husband didn't like the hard fries and didn't finish his refill. The place was not busy at all. Oh and when we got our check, they charged us $1.99 entertainment fee! What entertainment? They have a little TV looking thing on each table with games, but we never touched it. So I called the waitress over to have her remove the charge. So now I'm turned off from going back. I had to come home and eat. SMH
No complaints! The staff here is amazing and the food too! Krystal has served us a couple times and she is awesome! My wife loves this place and so does my 16 month old daughter.

First, the good news is...the chicken tenders are some of the best I've had anywhere.  But I did leave with a bad taste in my mouth. I ordered my food online for lunch and paid as well.  I know that there is curbside service, which is what I expected to use, but that didn't happen.  I did the curbside "thing" but still had to go inside to retrieve my lunch.  The host told me to go to the bar to pick up my order, and the girl who was working the bar at lunch today is one of the rudest wait staff I've encountered anywhere.  She sees me walk up but still turns her back on me to continue what she was doing.  I had to speak to get her attention, and then she told me to wait.  I told her I was just picking up an online order (and in fact, the food bag was sitting right there in front of her face and I pointed to it), but again, wait.  So wait I did, and watched her finish what she was doing, walk away from the bar for a couple minutes, then come back behind the bar, pull up my order, walk over to the bag, and handed it to me with no words.  In fact, she didn't even look at me or in my direction.  I felt like I was interrupting her work day, although, you know, waiting on customers is her work.  This occurred today at lunch time.  I work in a customer service oriented industry, and we are always looking for a way to serve better and its never a good look to have someone with absolutely no customer service skills handling your customers.  I would not have minded waiting at all if she had been polite about it, but that didn't happen.  Nevertheless, the chicken was good, but I won't be ordering it again from this particular store.
Waitress was rude, slow, and bossy also padded ticket. Then had nerve to ask for 22% tip  Not.  Burger looked nothing like picture. mashed , wet.  tasteless.  will never go back.

I'll start with a positive and that is I love the little tablets at the table for the kids to play games! That is genius!!! The customer service was very friendly and the Margaritas were yummy!! When we ordered our food my MIL's burger bun was completley soaked and soggy from the garlic sauce thing they put on it! The sauce was very good, and supposed to be on it but they clearly overdid it! I mean who wants to eat a soggy falling apart bun?  The waiter was very nice but errked me when he said, well I actually prefer it like that.. Ok that's you and if your prefer for your bun to fall and leave your hands face full of a greasy sauce that's you! My burger was delicious, as well as my Husbands but the quality didn't match the cost of the meals. My Mil's second burger came out but was still extremely greasy. I have been to the Red Robin in Temecula and Escondido and both of those places had a better décor and restaurant atmosphere as well as better food.. I won't be back to the Hemet location..

Great service. Was having a bad day and came here for a burger. When I arrived the staff was polite and energetic which made me feel better. On top of that I really appreciated to see and meet the manager, Blake R., who came by several times to ensure the meal and service was to my expectations. Honestly I have not seen such customer service from management and I am extremely impressed. I will be coming back because of the Blake and his staff. Well done guys
Always a great experience.  The team is one of the best assembled.  Great job to them, they won't let you done.

We gave the place a second chance after receiving a gift card from customer relations, and they definitely redeemed themselves!  Ryan was a wonderful server, and made sure we got our refills ;).  The hostess (can't recall her name) also went out of her way to be sure we were taken care of.  The food was delicious!  I'm glad we gave them another chance.  I can't give 5 stars because of our poor experience the first time around, but we will be back, and hopefully we have a great time again.  Food was decent, but nothing like other Red Robin restaurants I have been to.  Our server, Melissa, was impolite and inattentive.  Lunch was not very busy, but for some reason we had to continually search for our server and ask for refills.  Under par for this chain.  Won't be returning here.

Yesterday was my Birthday, so I went with my two daughters to get my free Birthday sandwich. I ordered the mushroom with Swiss cheese burger with tons of grilled onions. It was heaven on a bun. Meat cooked perfectly, a little pink, just the way I like it. The french fries were crispy and hot and the server we had was super nice. Only complaint was it took our server 20 minutes to take our order, but I found out later she had just come on duty, so it wasn't her fault. Other than that, this place is a winner in my book. Great food every time we visit.

Very rude to my wife, haven't been here in a while and was looking forward to it. Guessing we won't be here in a really long time. Thanks for messing up a good birthday meal for friends/clients. What a bummer, Crystal the bartender and server didn't listen to the order or drinks and couldn't stop at the table for more than 3 seconds without saying ok I will be right back. Sorry she was too busy for us.

Wow! Haven't been in a little while, and am completely shocked by what we experienced last night.  We were sat in the bar and the bartender was our server. She came over greeted us, and rushed away when we don't know exactly what we wanted right away. Upon second arrival she argued with me about a drink I have been enjoying there for years, and was quite nasty about it.  The attitude didn't let up the rest of the night and she even went as far as to come over and tell me they no longer carry the exact tequila so that's why they don't offer the drink...*rolls eyes* you can make it with other types of alcohol!  Our food orders were all pretty basic, of course mine was wrong and didn't shock me in the least. I just dealt with it and ate my food. Chicken was dry and salad was blah! We are still really doing iceberg Red Robin!?!? Really!?! Time to step up your game and join the big kids club, I think everyone else in town uses romaine. Fries weren't crispy like we asked for, so we had to wait for a new basket to come out.  Water refills were few and far between as the time spent at our table was so short and quick, that there wasn't even an opportunity to get the order in.  In Hemet we have a fairly good selection of sit down restaurants and I can tell you after last nights experience we won't be back for a long time to come! I suggest another option!

The food is great and we love the loyalty program but service in the bar area of this location is by far the worse. Im guessing because we don't have children the set us in her for a reason but I feel the service in the bar should be just as good as the normal dining room. If you feel like being ignored and passed by multiple servers and bartenders just have the host/hostess seat you in the bar area.
OH MY GOODNESS the floor is disgusting. I just sat down. How is this ok??? Unfortunately this has happened before. What is going on here????

Simply the best Red Robin I've ever been to. I never eat at the bar or order drinks so this review is for non-bar area. I've been here twice now during the daytime and the service is outstanding and the food is great. My favorite things here are the A1 peppercorn burger, the garlic Parmesan fries, and the bottomless strawberry lemonade.

My girlfriend and I love to come to Red Robin to grab a burger. The servers are always super sweet and attentive and your food is ready fast and always prepared correctly... but this time was a little different. My girlfriend was hungry so I got her favorite burger for her To-go: The Burnin' Love. Her order was perfect with tons of fries. As she was eating she noticed a plastic tag in her fries! She was grossed out and wondered where the fries had been and couldn't finish the rest of her food. We were very disappointed as we have never had a negative experience at any Red Robin location. Such a shame.

The worst burger experience I have had happened here last night. I went to eat there around 8:30pm and I was starving. Not only did I have to wait a long time to be seated but I had to walk to the back of the restaurant find someone to help us. I ordered an appetizer the same time ordering my food and when my food came out I asked him what happened to the appetizer. He looked confused so I told him to just cancel it. But wait It gets worseee....like I stated earlier I was starving so I hurry up and start eating my turkey burger but as I take like my fourth bite I realize it feels really soft and I can't taste any meat. I look down and touch my patty and literally it was raw. This burger felt like it may have sat on their grill for 1 min or less. The inside wasn't even a little bit cooked. When I showed my waiter he didn't really care. Yes, he brought me out another turkey burger but for the burger to be so raw he should have showed some more customer service. My stomach has been paying for it all day.

Great wait staff, but some holes. We went in for dinner, had to wait a few minutes, but no big deal.  The food we got was good for the most part but there are a number of disconnects between wait staff and the kitchen.  Very nice waitress took our order promptly,  asked if we were in Royalty Club ( we are but didn't have the card) so she said she'd fix that later- never happened. We asked for a refill on freckled lemonade, didn't come, so we asked again and then we got two.  We were asked if we wanted a refill on bottomless fries,  they never came.  What appears to be happening is that the order goes back to the kitchen via a touchscreen station and the the order gets lost back there somewhere.  Bottom line, the food is just ok, don't know what's up with the service. I can't fault the front wait staff, but I won't hurry back.  Btw I never short the wait staff on a tip unless they're just plain rude. But it's hard to get enthused about returning. Update since the last time-  1 star this time.  Do not be in a hurry because things are incredibly slow. Walked in@ 7pm on a Monday night and 30 minutes  plus to fill a simple order.  Won't be back- strike 2

Best thing at lunch time it's been that there's no lines. We hadn't been there in a while but decided to take my daughters teacher from a couple years ago out to lunch because we love her and missed her so... we did and she enjoyed a nice relaxed lunch and conversation. The fish platter or whatever came out Nantucket? Or smth ? Looked overcooked and too brown but maybe it's supposed to be that crispy I don't know. All in all even though it isn't very impressive food the kids enjoyed their burgers and fries and the adults enjoyed the service and conversation and the lack of noise inside the place so all in all a good experience.
I go here when I want the best burger "banzai" definitely the best and the service is great
Love coming here for an early lunch. The staff is very friendly and quick.

Bar area seating on a later Saturday night dinner. The bar tender is forced to service the bar and the bar area; which I'm guessing affects the service.  Food: was alright, find a coupon; save a couple bucks, bottomless fries as with the other red robbin locations all the way to the coastal regions are slow in coming (we get it, you don't like giving the fries away - I guess the potato market is skyrocketing in price).  Enjoy the season salt and option in dipping sauces, but seriously; you charge for certain sauce to dip them in?? Drink: The tea's were umm...I'm guessing lacking fountain liquid; each one had a strange lacking to them Service: Was alright saw the bartender a couple times and 2 others dropping off food Price: With a coupon was fair $23 for 2 people Red Robin; stop guarding your bottomless fries; its not that serious and the reason I choose your spot, make it a selling point

Two stars is mainly for food. After walking out a week before for service being inattentive. Service was ok when he finally came to the table this time, 15 minutes after we sat down. 20 minutes pass, no silverware set ups, no drinks, not even water. This kid had a few other tables but it was a slow to steady Tuesday night. If your staff can't handle the floor time to find some people who can. I grew up in corona and luckily had an awesome experience everyone going to Red Robin. Unfortunately I guess living out here my daughter won't get to experience it.

Had a great experience dining here tonight.  Our waitress, Rebecca Joe was amazing!  Kept our drinks full (key to a 20% or higher tip from me), she was funny and great with customers and kept the fries coming.  Best experience here ever for us.

While there was a bit of a wait we were seated and service was fine. The food was fine and the table was clean. The only issue is that if someone asked to split a burger don't cut it with the metal wrapper on it and get metal foil pieces in the burger. Someone could choke. Otherwise I don't have any real complaints.

Got a coupon in the mail and decided to try this place in Hemet today.  They have a large selection of burgers along with customizable options.   You can sub chicken turkey and even veggie burger for many of their selections.  Fries are also served hot crisp and well seasoned.  Another great part of our visit today was our server Brenna, her attitude smile and wonderful customer service are a true asset to this restaurant.

Yes, their food is great! I love coming here for their burgers and beer. It's in town which is convenient don't have to drive to far for a good burger and well this post is mainly about their customers service. Today I went to go have dinner with a friend got fried pickles (so good) and bottomless fries which is a basic for everyone. I decided to get a A1 burger which was my mistake as soon as I took a bite, I knew I didn't want it anymore the bread was dry and dusty tasting. I told my friend but did not want to say anything about it because I know cooking takes time and it was a big burger I did not want to make the chef upset for wasting food. So I kept eating it. Our server "will" passed by and asked if everything was great, of course I said yes. My friend decided to share that I was unhappy with my burger and "will" was so kind about he suggested I change my order and that it was no problem, he does the same when he goes out. After that I was very pleased changing my order and truly got what I wanted. Thanks will.
I ate here last night with a friend and got insane food poisoning. Super disappointed:( had the whisky river bbq wrap. Guess the chicken was bad/ undercooked

This was the worst experience ever. I literally came into Red Robins, nobody approached me (but all the workers were just looking at me in the front like I should seat myself). I decided to go seat myself after being unacknowledged at the bar, where a guy who works the bar looked at me, seen I was at the bar and turned right back around. I started feeling really uncomfortable so I pulled out my phone too see how long it would be before I was approached. The worker who looked at me and looked away noticed I was recording and looked frustrated so he automatically asked me (looking in my camera) "what can I get you to drink", I replied just water. The bartender seriously questioned me asking why I was recording him, I told him I was recording myself because it is my birthday (Jan 3rd). He got mad and threw down a couple cold drink pads and set my water on one. I told him too please not throw my items, he replied back "dude you're at a bar". I explained to him I don't care where I was at, I don't want my items thrown at me, he started going back and forth with me so I asked for the manager. The manager approached me very non caring explaining to me that if I record myself that I would be kicked out of the restaurant due to a post on the Window stating "no trespassing". I asked where it was posted that I couldn't record myself in his restaurant and he just replied back "do you want a seat"? I replied to him "no I would like the customer service too be better cause I'm literally uncomfortable now". I asked his name and he did not give it too me out of fear of the bold disrespect/discrimination I was receiving. Thankfully I know an ex employee who explained his name was Javier and I definitely called Human resources on him specifically because I was almost kicked out for no reason. Would definitely not recommend eating here especially if you're African American specifically.
Always a great place for lunch! Every time my family eats here we are never disappointed. Plus the customer service is on point try this place if you haven't already.

Overall I will say service at this location is good. I've only had 1 experience that I can remember off the top of my head when the waitress literally took our order then gave us the check when we requested it...no refills, never checked up on us, so no tip. My favorite server is Cheryl, she always has a big, kind smile on her face, she's quick to get us what we need and she swings by every so often to see how we are doing. I give Cheryl 5 stars and the restaurant 4. The food is always good, hot and fresh
